newsitem.title: HUNGARY: BASKET DEALS,SFR IN FOCUS ON HUNGARY FX FUTURES.
newsitem.headline: BASKET DEALS,SFR IN FOCUS ON HUNGARY FX FUTURES.

text.p: Dollar/mark basket deals continued to feature on Hungary's currency futures market on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) on Tuesday, with the Swiss franc also registering significant turnover.

Basket deals, by which dollars and marks are traded in the 30/70 proportion they represent in the central bank's currency basket against which the forint floats, are seen as a way of hedging against large dollar/mark fluctuations.
On Tuesday such deals concentrated on the June maturity, with the mark rising 0.7 to 123.35 forints and the dollar rising 0.16 to 208.5.
The mark fell for all other months.
The 6,066 lots in the Swiss franc were split between September, which fell 0.5 to 133.0 forints, and December, which fell 0.2 to 139.3.
BCE turnover stood at a moderately large 4.967 billion forints.
The smaller Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE) saw just one trade worth 11 million forints for the December mark, which fell 0.02 to 115.25 forints.
